qas.question: Who influenced many 19th century neoclassical architects?

answers.text: Étienne-Louis Boullée and Claude Nicolas Ledoux

qas.question: What do geometric architecture emulate of the universe?
What Edmund Burke concept is linked to Boullee's ideas?
As a concept of neoclassical architecture, what should be immediately communicated to viewer?

answers.text: building should immediately communicate its function

plausible_answers.text: the drawings and projects of Étienne-Louis Boullée and Claude Nicolas Ledoux

qas.question: What influence neoclassical architecture in the 1900s?

plausible_answers.text: spare geometrical architecture that emulates the eternality of the universe

qas.question: What did the drawings of Claude Nicholas Lediux depicts?
Whose ideas are linked to Boullee's ideas of the sublime?

plausible_answers.text: a building should immediately communicate its function to the viewer

qas.question: What did Burke say about the concept of architectural character?

context: Many early 19th-century neoclassical architects were influenced by <b5_0>the drawings and projects of <a0_0>Étienne-Louis Boullée and Claude Nicolas Ledoux<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The many graphite drawings of Boullée and his students depict <b6_0>spare geometrical architecture that emulates the <a1_0>eternality<a1_0/> of the universe<b6_0/>. There are links between Boullée's ideas and <b7_0>Edmund Burke's<b7_0/> conception of the <a2_0>sublime<a2_0/>. Ledoux addressed the concept of <a3_0>architectural character<a3_0/>, maintaining that <b8_0>a <a4_0>building should immediately communicate its function<a4_0/> to the viewer<b8_0/>: taken literally such ideas give rise to "architecture parlante".
